comment._content: www.smithsonianmag.com/history-archaeology/pietown.html?c... Great article with the history of Pie Town inspired by these photographs.

comment.author: 76279112@N00
comment._content: This could have been taken recently it looks so good... Never knew these color pictures were around.  An amazing series.

comment.author: 35381662@N00
comment._content: Neat how the clothing style on these two is 67 years old, but looks completely current.

comment.author: 23248150@N06
comment._content: this photo also exhibits nice depth of field

comment.author: 7533073@N04
comment._content:
Just had a thought. Does anybody think all of our digital photo on Flickr or any thing else will be able to be seen by our great grandchildren sixty plus years from now?

I use digital for throwaway photos, anything important I capture on real film.

comment.author: 11779494@N00
comment._content: This sure makes me miss film...

comment.author: 23680544@N07
comment._content: Aww - That's such a cool capture. Great project idea!

comment.author: 30120284@N03
comment._content: I love the bouquet of wild flowers on the ground; you can see the little girl was picking them.  I guess little girls don't change much over the years my niece did this same thing too.

comment.author: 48889055628@N01
comment._content: It's nice to see an intimate portrait of a father and child from that time period. I know I tend to think of fathers from that time period as being aloof from their kids. As for his clothing, it does look very contemporary, except for the hat. I'd wear that shirt today, no problem.
